hume
Class Agent

java.lang.Object
  hume.Agent

public class Agent
extends java.lang.Object

The Agent class defines the agent's properties and their behaviour.

Author:
eckhart

Field Detail

numCompetences

public static int numCompetences
Ther upper limit for the number of problems (Draft 28.11, p.6). Other than in the draft the problems are numbered from zero to numProblems-1. Starting to count from zero simplifies indexing.

Constructor Detail

Agent

public Agent()
Constructs an agent object. Before constructing an agent object the static fields numCompetences, network must be assigned with suitable values.

Agent

public Agent(double localTrustworthiness,
             double marketTrustworthiness,
             double localTrust,
             double marketTrust)
Constructs an agent object with the given trustworthiness and trust levels. Before constructing an agent object the static fields numCompetences, network must be assigned with suitable values.

Method Detail

competence

public double competence(int problem)
Returns the agent's competence for solving a certain problem.

normalizeCompetences

public void normalizeCompetences()
Normalizes the competences vector so that its components add up to one.

acquireCompetence

protected void acquireCompetence(int problem)
Increases the competence for solving a certain problem at the expense of the competences for solving other problems. (Draft 28.11., p. 7)

Parameters:
problem - the problem for the solution of which the competence shall be increased.

stepFunction

protected double stepFunction(double distance,
                              double radius)
A step functions that determines whether to use the local trustworthiness or the market trustworthiness depending on the distance (towards another agent) and the neighborhood radius.

Parameters:
distance -
radius -
Returns:
the probability of being trustworthy

assignProblem

public void assignProblem(int problem)
Assings a new problem to the agent. This method also implicitely notifies the agent that a new round has started. The agent resets all round-specific variables within this method.

Parameters:
problem - the problem that occured to the agent

setAspirationLevel

public void setAspirationLevel(double aspirationLevel)
Sets the aspirationLevel of the agent. As determining the aspiration level is part of the matching procdure, the algorithm that determines the aspiration level is implemented in a descendant of the Matching class and is suppoed to invoke the agent's method setAspirationLevel as appropriate.

Parameters:
aspirationLevel - the aspiration level of the agent regarding an external solution of its problem.

trust

public boolean trust(Agent other)
Returns true, if the agent is willing to trust the other agent. Presently, only a very simple algorithm is implemented which assumes that the agent is able to "smell" the trustworthiness of the other agent with some degree of reliability. The actual propensity to trust the other agent is to one half determined by the trust level of the agent and to one half by the actual trsutworthiness of the other agent. (Both, the agent's trust level and the the other agent's trustworthiness level do of course depend on the network distance of the agents.) Thus: propensity = 0.5 * trust + 0.5 * trustworthiness

Parameters:
other - the other agent

exploit

public boolean exploit(Agent other)
Returns true, if the agent will exploit the other agent. The result returned is always the same during one round, i.e. the agent decides only whether to be an exploiter or not only the first time the method exploit is called. After that it always sticks with this decision until a new round is started (i.e. a new problem is assigned).

Parameters:
other - the other agent

exploit

public boolean exploit(double distance)
Returns true, if the agent will exploit an agent to which it has the given network-distance. The result returned is always the same during one round. i.e. the agent decides only whether to be an exploiter or not only the first time the method exploit is called. After that it always sticks with this decision until a new round is started (i.e. a new problem is assigned).

Parameters:
distance - the network distance to determine exploitation.

receivePayoff

public void receivePayoff(double payoff)
Updates the variable accumulatedPayoff with the payoff received in the current round according to the forumula: accumulatedPayoff = accumulatedPayoff * payoffDiscount + payoff

Parameters:
payoff - the payoff received during this round
